intro: Stylocline sonorensis, commonly known as the Sonoran stylocline, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, often branched stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Stylocline sonorensis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique adaptations to desert environments.
